title: Grand Old Auto Names Merged Into the Unknown
sub_head: Successful global companies merged and exchanged many renowned brands including for Stellantis, a name that gives no clue to its product or biographical history.
body:
In “The Best Company Name Is Under Where?” (op-ed, Feb. 5), Gregg Opelka misses the biggest blunder in the history of the automobile business when a couple of successful global companies merged and exchanged many renowned brands including, Alfa Romeo, Citroën, Chrysler, Fiat , Jeep, Maserati and Peugeot, for a name that gives no clue to its product or biographical history—“Stellantis”—what a travesty.
George Brata
Shelby Township, Mich.
